name: Justice is Blind Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of the fake disease that Maeby's fake twin has?
questions.explanation:
BS.

	Maeby uses the 'dying girl' routine in order to earn more money from the kids at her school.  George Michael decides to prove to everyone that everything was a fraud, because like Michael, he believes in doing the right thing.  Maeby expects to kill off her fake twin before graduation so that everyone's sad before prom.

questions.text: Where is the statue of the Ten Commandments that Lindsay wants to get rid of?
questions.explanation:
The courthouse.

	Lindsay is angry with the statue because she broke one of her high-heeled shoes on it.  She decides to team up with local protesters to remove the statue once and for all.  Only hours after receiving a notice about it, Lindsay began calling around and protesting the statue.

questions.text: When did Gob switch the files in the folder with magazines?
questions.correct: When Lindsay, Tobias and Michael were talking
options: When Michael went to confess to Maggie
When everyone left to see George Sr. in prison
questions.explanation:
When Lindsay, Tobias and Michael were talking.

	Thinking that he's done the right thing, Gob takes the files to George Sr. in prison.  The night before, Michael found out from Maggie that everything in the folder was fake because she knew that Michael was a Bluth when he was in the courtroom.  She'd been manipulating him ever since.

questions.text: Where does Lucille leave Annyong and Buster while she's talking with Gob, George Sr. and Barry in prison?
questions.explanation:
In the waiting room.

	Annyong gets Buster nervous because Buster knows that when (and if) George Sr. returns home, he's going to have to move out because George Sr. doesn't want Buster living with him after retirement.  Annyong says that it will probably happen because they'll take the plea.

questions.text: Who does the family have break into Maggie's house to steal the evidence?
questions.explanation:
Tobias.

	After George Sr. tells Gob to steal the evidence, he passes the torch to Tobias who made an earlier remark about being swift and agile like a cat.  Tobias proudly accepts the offer, and winds up at Maggie's house just as she arrives home.

Buster.

	Buster demands that he and Lucille have immunity from everything that's going on in return for evidence against the family.  He wants to prevent George Sr. from leaving prison so that he doesn't go home and kick Buster out of the house, and he wants Annyong to go back to Korea.

questions.text: Maggie's dog, Justice, isn't registered as a seeing-eye dog.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Justice isn't registered, and when Michael takes Justice to the vet, he discovers that Justice is blind, and he realizes that Maggie isn't.  Instead, Maggie's been leading Justice around and dressing him up as a seeing-eye dog.

questions.text: What does Maggie bring around the house when Tobias is trying to steal the evidence?
questions.explanation:
A bat.

	After Maggie arrives home, Tobias continues to try and takes some of the evidence, but she forces him back to the back door.  Michael ends up bringing Justice home, and as Maggie's about to hit Tobias with the bat, he sprays her in the eyes with mace and runs.

questions.text: What does Michael throw at Maggie in court?
questions.explanation:
A bible.

	After Michael realizes that Maggie is blind, he decides to prove it to everybody in court by throwing a bible at her.  He thought that it would prove that she wasn't blind and they'd have the upper hand in the trial, but Tobias temporarily blinded her when he sprayed mace into her eyes at her house.

questions.text: George Michael proves that Maeby was faking everything.
questions.explanation:
False.

	In the end, she's still fundraising money for her fake disease.  Michael and Maggie decide to break up, and Maggie decides to tell everyone that when she was struck by the bible it restored her vision.
